title: Bond Yields Fall, Stock Futures Waver Ahead of Fed Minutes
sub_head: S&P 500 is set to inch lower, Turkish lira bounces and Brent crude creeps higher
body:
U.S. stock futures paused as investors awaited a bumper day of economic data releases ahead of the Thanksgiving holiday, plus minutes from the Federal Reserveâ€™s latest meeting.
Futures tied to the S&P 500 edged down 0.1% Wednesday, while blue-chip Dow Jones Industrial Average Futures weakened by 0.2%. Technology-heavy Nasdaq-100 futures crept up 0.1%, a day after tech firms were an area of weakness for the stock market, in part due to rising bond yields.
